product_a.name: GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum
product_a.how_to_use: Apply 2–3 drops in the morning before sunscreen

ingredients.analysis: GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum and VitaGlow share similar key ingredients, including Vitamin C and a form of Hyaluronic Acid, which can help with skin hydration and brightening. However, GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum specifically lists "Hyaluronic Acid", while VitaGlow lists "Hyaluronic", suggesting a possible difference in formulation or concentration between the two products.

benefits.analysis: Both GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum and VitaGlow offer similar benefits, including fading dark spots and brightening the skin, but GlowBoost is specifically formulated with vitamin C for enhanced brightening effects. Ultimately, the choice between the two products may come down to personal preference, as both serums appear to provide comparable results in terms of spot fading and skin brightening.

product_type.analysis: GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum offers 10% Vitamin C, while VitaGlow provides Vitamin C Serum.

recommendation: GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum (₹699) offers Brightening, Fades dark spots. VitaGlow (₹599) provides Fades spots, Brightens skin. Choose based on your specific needs and budget.
